title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: The shoreline near the Southwest Camp basks in the overhead sun, bright light reflecting from the shallow pools where Kestodon and Aptonoth water. Ahead you see the entrance to the Ancient Forest, formed by an arch of thick boughs, yawning open like a gaping maw… the sounds from the world behind you fade away to silence as you step under the rich green canopy, leaving an all-too-brief sense of calm, soon broken as the Scoutflies excitedly cluster around a huge footprint in the soil.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 21.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: A Great Jagras is on the loose; the last week has presented you with plentiful evidence – dozens of corpses, ripped apart in a frenzy, and left half eaten. This will be a hunt to test even the most experienced of trackers. You’ve heard of Jagras consuming hunters in a single bite. That won’t be you.

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Great Jagras Claw.

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 27.

prompt.text: Stay and dig around the remains?

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone medium.
Progress to entry 25.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: The handler standing by the tracks gives you an appraising glance. ‘I’d be very careful pursuing this beast,’ she says, idly scratching her chin. ‘It’s aggressive even by Jagras standards. But, if you insist on tracking it, take that route…’ she gestures to a dirt path leading into the forest. ‘It’s still hungry. Good luck!’ Her warning said, she vanishes into the forest.

prompt.text: Follow her advice, and slowly advance.

rules.text: Gain and reveal 1 track token, then choose whether to keep or discard it. Progress to entry 26.

prompt.text: With so many tracks, there’s no time to waste!

rules.text: Gain 2 track tokens. Progress to entry 16.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: The beach stretches out before you, an exquisite expanse of untouched sand. The sea surges across it, leaving glistening foam to mark each wave. The forest rises behind you, an oppressive memory, but you may have to withdraw back into its ferny grip and leave this beautiful scene behind. Do you…

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: Head back into the forest, towards a camp you can see between the trees.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 9.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: The thunder of water threatens to distract your mind as you scan the nearby terrain. Great Jagras is on the hunt, and you’re on its trail. The river below surges into the forest, and the thick foliage of the trees obscures the path of the creature you seek.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens.
Progress to entry 13.
Discard 2 time cards. Each Hunter gains 1 Piercing Claw and 1 Monster Bone Large. Progress to entry 24.

prompt.text: Head downriver to where Great Jagras was last seen.

rules.text: Discard 1 time cards. Progress to entry 14.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 5 time cards. Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: Just when you are about to lose heart you come across a pile of Great Jagras dung, left in the wake of your prey. It may be a grisly sight, but it fills your heart with hope as you head for a clearing ahead.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 3 track tokens.
Progress to entry 18.

prompt.text: Wait, listen… is that something behind us?

rules.text: Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: Flickering light paints eerie shadows across the walls, dancing pools of  darkness that give mind to vicious predators. Your feet kick up dust and  crunch through tiny bones, revealing sparkling metals and gems…

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter rolls on the following table.

1-2 Gain 1 Dragonite Ore
3-4 Gain 1 Fucium Ore
5-6 Gain 1 Ancient Bone

Once each hunter has rolled.
Progress to entry 11.

prompt.text: Turn back from this sinister place.

rules.text: Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: Have you been this way before? Things look familiar. But then…the forest  always looks familiar. You’re definitely lost. Eventually, you see a cave,  something in the rocks outside glittering in the sun. You’re about to use  your pick, when you see some tracks, half buried in the dust.

prompt.text: Mine the ore, then enter the cave.

rules.text:
Discard 1 track token.
Each hunter rolls on the following table.

1-2 Gain 1 Dragonite Ore
3-4 Gain 1 Fucium Ore
5-6 Gain 1 Firecell Ore

Once each hunter has rolled. Progress to entry 7.

prompt.text: Follow the tracks you can see, and hope they’re fresh.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 6.

flavor.text: A host of Palico gather at the edge of the camp as you draw near, mewing with interest. The creatures quickly resume their training drills, dodging and darting around the encampment as you take a few moments to rest. The hunt has to continue, but, for a few moments, being among the Palico is a cure for the perils of your work.

rules.text:
Each hunter that does not have a Palico draws a Palico card.
They may use it during the next hunting phase, then it is discarded. Progress to entry 29.

Gain and reveal 4 track tokens, then choose whether to keep or discard them.
Progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: You’ve stalked through the forest, intricately and carefully made your way…to the same cave you’ve visited many times before. Still, perhaps, there might yet be some ore to be discovered.

rules.text:
Roll a die.
On a 1-4 all of the ore has been mined.
Time to hurry on. Progress to entry 18.
On a 5-6 there’s still some here. Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter gains 1 Carbalite ore, and 1 Machalite ore.
Progress to entry 7.

flavor.text: Something huge has clearly passed through this way, fresh markings cover the walls where it squeezed its huge bulk through the passageway. This warren is a maze; you can either rush on blindly, or stop to get your bearings.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens.
Progress to entry 30.

Discard 1 time card. Reveal up to three tokens from the pool.
Progress to entry 18.

flavor.text: Lightheaded and breathing heavily, you lean against the bark of a thick  tree. Your arms ache, numbness creeping through them towards your  shoulders. If only there were a way to relieve your parched throat…

rules.text: All hunters suffer 2 damage. Progress to entry 6.

condition.text: (The hunters may only choose this option if they have at least 1 potion)

rules.text: Discard 1 potion. Progress to entry 6.

flavor.text: ‘What can I help you with?’ says the small man as you pass him. You should have recognised him as a trader sooner. He grins and gestures to the pack on his back. ‘I’ve got anything you might need, just here!’ You’re sure he does, but you know it’s going to cost you…

rules.text:
The players may discard any three resources, and add 1 Potion to the pool, or gain 1 track token.
If they do, discard 1 time card.
Progress to entry 10.

flavor.text: ‘Your prey is near… keep up the pace!’ intones a voice, from somewhere amidst the trees. You can’t locate the voice, but it isn’t wrong. Great Jagras is close, and you’re gaining on it. It won’t take much to bring it to heel… but who is speaking to you?

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Great Jagras Claw.

rules.text: Progress to entry 13.

prompt.text: Ignore it and continue searching through the creature’s nest.

condition.text: (The players may only select this option if they have at least 1 Great Jagras Hide in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Gain 1 Great Jagras Mane.
Progress to entry 24.

flavor.text: The light has begun to dim, the sun setting behind the tall trees on the horizon. If you plan on maintaining the hunt, you’ll need to race ahead, or you can make camp for the evening and resume tomorrow.

prompt.text: We can’t waste any time. Keep up the chase!

rules.text:
Shuffle the Rushed Advance card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 30.

Discard 2 time cards, all hunters heal to full.
Progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: A roar fills the air, echoing across the forest. The beast is nearby. A discarded pack lies on the ground in the middle of the path, the strap torn. But is this a trap?

rules.text:
Roll a die.
On a 1-2 No time!
Progress to entry 27.
On a 3-4 Take the bag before it is upon you!
Add 1 potion to the pool. Progress to entry 27.
On a 5-6 Snatch up the ores from the ground!
Each hunter gains 1 Carbalite ore, and 1 Machalite ore.
Progress to entry 27.

prompt.text: Leave it and explore through a gap in the trees.

rules.text: Progress to entry 29.

flavor.text: Another dead Great Jagras. This one was brought down from above… some vast aerial predator ripped it to shreds. You scan the air carefully, desperate to ensure that you aren’t surprised as Great Jagras was, but the corpse is intact. You want that hide… and those scales.

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Great Jagras Hide.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Gain 1 Great Jagras Scale.
Progress to entry 6.
Progress to entry 28.

flavor.text: You emerge into brilliant sunlight, a fast-flowing river gurgling beside you. A trail of fresh footprints has been stamped into the mud, a path leading you forward.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 28.

prompt.text: Stop to examine them more closely.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Discard 1 track token.
Progress to entry 15.

flavor.text: A new day dawns over the Ancient Forest, revealing fresh footprints through the morning dew. Your prey is close, and for a moment you wonder if you are the hunter or the hunted…

rules.text:
If the group has four or less track tokens, gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: For a moment, as you move through the jungle, you’re convinced the Great Jagras has caught you. Until the vast beast remains unmoving, even as you approach it. The creature is dead. Dead of old age, it looks like. Its eyes are pale with cataracts, its scales no longer vibrant. You’ve beaten the scavengers to the corpse, it’s untouched. It won’t last long.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Each hunter gains 1 Great Jagras Scale.
If the group has at least 1 Great Jagras Mane, each hunter also gains 1 additional Great Jagras Mane.
Progress to entry 15.

prompt.text: Return to the trail, and head for a camp you can see between the trees.

rules.text: Progress to entry 9.

flavor.text: You follow a well-used trail, scrapes and gouges in the dirt and along the trees betraying the monsters that frequently pass through this way. The gnawed bone of a monster, picked clean of meat, lays discarded to one side.

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone medium.

prompt.text: Hurry to follow the tracks along the trail?

rules.text: Gain 1 track token. Progress to entry 23.

prompt.text: Stop to search for other bones nearby?

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Quality Bone and 1 Monster Bone Small. Progress to entry 23.

flavor.text: Two butchered Kestodon lie exposed beneath the unforgiving sun. Their flesh is already starting to turn. You’ve only got a few hours before anything useful on either corpse will be ruined by descending scavengers.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Piercing Claw,
and 1 Monster Hardbone. Progress to entry 25.
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track tokens. Progress to entry 20.

flavor.text: The trees ahead are far older and have considerably thicker foliage—it  would be exhausting to hack through. Alternatively, a trail of ore along the path leads to a large cave opening in the distance. You might search there, in hope of finding your prey’s den…

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Carbalite ore, and 1 Machalite ore.

prompt.text: Cut your way through the forest.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 12.
Discard 2 time cards. Progress to entry 7.

flavor.text: After an hour’s exploration of the area, you stumble across something strange. A series of unusual shapes wreathed in green. You manage to strip away the moss and vines grown around the strange stone idols, before you recognise what they are. Ancient funeral stones, long forgotten.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Shuffle a Jagras Slayer card into time deck.
Progress to entry 27.

prompt.text: Dip your head reverently… but hurry on.

rules.text:
Shuffle an Unavenged card into time deck.
Progress to entry 26.

flavor.text: The brush nearby contains another corpse. Another dead Aptonoth. But it might be worth examining further. Gleaning any details about Great Jagras might be invaluable later.

prompt.text: Spend some time cleaning the bones off so you can take them with you?

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards.
Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone Large and 1 Great Jagras Scale. Progress to entry 27.
Progress to entry 8.

flavor.text: A vast assemblage of bones, desiccated flesh, and shattered teeth greets you as you step out of the ring of trees. This is where the titans come to die; a monster graveyard. Nearby, there’s a fresh carcass. From the marks on its throat, it was a victim of Great Jagras. Another one. You’re on its trail though, and from what you know of the beast’s path, there’s a shortcut that should bring you out right on top of it…

prompt.text: Take the time to strip the carcass.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Each hunter gains 1 Monster Keenbone.
Progress to entry 29.

Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens.
Progress to entry 28.

prompt.text: What’s that shaggy pile over there?

condition.text: (The players may only choose this option if they have at least 1 Great Jagras hide in their inventories)

rules.text: Progress to entry 17.

flavor.text: Small Jagras erupt from the brush, surrounding and snapping at you with desperate hunger. You’re overwhelmed, and, for a moment, think you might be dragged under. Your training gets you through, driving the pack away and giving you a moment to breathe. But they’re about to attack again…

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Each hunter suffers 1 damage,
then gains 1 Sharp Claw. Progress to entry 12.
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 29.

flavor.text: A scream cuts through the air. Up ahead, a bloodied satchel lays unattended on the ground—it seems that something has caught up with one of the field researchers. Surely you can’t leave them to their fate, can you?

prompt.text: No, we can’t. Abandon the hunt to save them!

rules.text:
Discard 1 track token and shuffle a Researcher’s Favour
card into the time deck. Progress to entry 15.

prompt.text: Yes, we can. Search the satchel, and head for a safer location.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Coral Crystal,
then add 1 Potion to the pool. Progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: The carcass you’ve stumbled upon is impossibly old. Older than mankind, you’re sure. A creature long forgotten but still, even in death, magnificent. Your breath catches in your throat as you imagine the battles this creature must have fought.

prompt.text: Reverently take a bone before leaving.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Ancient Bone.
Progress to entry 6.
Discard 1 time card. Shuffle an Ancient Guardian card into time deck. Progress to entry 18.

flavor.text: A deafening roar is your only warning, as you suddenly find yourself face to face with your prey! Now is the time to fight this terrifying adversary.

rules.text: Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: The shoreline near the Southwest Camp basks in the overhead sun, bright light reflecting from the shallow pools where Kestodon and Aptonoth water. Ahead you see the entrance to the Ancient Forest, formed by an arch of thick boughs, yawning open like a gaping maw… the sounds from the world behind you fade away to silence as you step under the rich green canopy, leaving an all-too-brief sense of calm, soon broken as the Scoutflies excitedly cluster around a huge footprint in the soil.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 21.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: An Anjanath, this close to the camp? Well, it will save your boots, but the creature’s proximity isn’t going to end well for anyone. It needs to be dealt with, and soon. So, what are you waiting for? Get hunting! The forest near the encampment is rich with Aptonoth—the brute’s favourite meal—and its constant search for prey always brings it this way. A brief search of the area reveals a few Aptonoth bones, picked clean. The start of a trail, perhaps? But there are rumours of Anjanath in the next valley. What do your hunter’s instincts say?

prompt.text: Follow the trail of bones, and head to the pond.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Monster Hardbone.
Progress to entry 12.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 7 time cards. Progress to entry 29.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: The journey to camp has been hard. A hike through close-packed forest, swarming with insect life determined to snack on you. After hours of hacking through foliage, you emerge onto the shore of a lake, at the edge of which lies a bloated corpse. Flies hum around spoiling meat. Judging by the bite radius, it was an Anjanath that slaughtered it. You spit, trying to cleanse your mouth of the taste of rotting flesh, and then brace yourself for the hunt.

rules.text:
You’ve learned all you can. Look around for tracks.
Progress to entry 17.

Each hunter gains 1 Monster Keenbone, and 1 Quality Bone.
Progress to entry 21.

prompt.text: Size it up and follow the trail!

condition.text: (The players may only choose this option if they have at least 1 Anjanath Fang in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Each hunter gains 1 Anjanath Fang. Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 7 time cards. Progress to entry 29.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: The stench of marshland is impossible to escape, filling your nostrils. The ground is soft underfoot, sucking your boots beneath the surface, as you push aside reeds and try to determine where is safe to step next. It’s strange ground for an Anjanath hunt, but the rumours say that one has been seen nearby. And you trust your sources. So here you are, trying to avoid sinking too deeply into the quagmire, on the trail of an Anjanath…

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Each hunter gains 1 Potion,
and 1 Monster Hardbone. Progress to entry 18.

Gain 3 track tokens. Discard two time cards and place
them to one side of the deck. Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 7 time cards. Progress to entry 29.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 2 potions.

flavor.text: You’re in the caves, surrounded by granite and quartz, and the inescapable smell of Anjanath. Singed fur, decomposing meat, and broken teeth lie on the sandy floor. The stench of predation and death is everywhere.

prompt.text: Follow the tracks of the creature out of the cave.

rules.text:
Shuffle an Aimless Wandering card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 18.
Discard 1 time card. Gain 2 track tokens. Progress to entry 6.

prompt.text: Take a fang, then move on!

condition.text: (The players may only choose this option if they have at least 1 Anjanath Fang in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Anjanath Tail.
Progress to entry 20.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 7 time cards. Progress to entry 29.

title-rule.text: If starting the adventure here, the group gains 1 potion.

flavor.text: A brutal fight happened here. Blood is everywhere, along with ruined teeth, and hunks of ragged flesh. A trail leads off into the forest; a wounded Anjanath is on the loose. You’ll need to move quickly if you want to catch it, but be wary… a wounded Anjanath can be lethal.

rules.text: Progress to entry 4.
Progress to entry 22.

condition.text: (The players may only choose this option if they have at least 1 Anjanath Pelt in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Anjanath Tail.
Progress to entry 8.

prompt.text: Race to where your prey was last seen!

rules.text: Discard 7 time cards. Progress to entry 29.

flavor.text: The shrill calls of Rathalos echo around you. Three, four, five of them? And then other calls behind you! This place is alive with Rathalos. A nest… and you’ve stumbled right into the midst of it. Anjanath might have been here, but it didn’t stay long. It wouldn’t be alive if it had…

prompt.text: Run before Rathalos catches your scent.

rules.text:
Get away from this place!
Each hunter gains 1 Anjanath Fang.
Progress to entry 28.

flavor.text: The forest recedes a little, giving you a moment to try and orient yourself. The intensity of the pursuit has left you lost… but the tracks are still clear. Do you really need to know where you are?

consequences.text: Discard 1 time card and place it to one side of the deck.

prompt.text:
Keep following the tracks.
You can work out where you are later.

rules.text:
Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 8.

Discard 2 time cards.
Reveal and discard any number of track tokens.
Discard any time cards to the side of the time deck.
Progress to entry 8.

flavor.text: The sun makes your eyes water but it’s a struggle to shut them. It had felt, for a few minutes as you dragged yourself out of that cave, like you might never see the sun again. But enough sentiment. There’s an Anjanath to hunt. Time to get on with it.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card and place it to one side of the deck.
Progress to entry 14.

prompt.text: Somewhere nearby you hear a hoarse roar…

condition.text: (The players may only choose this option if they are on the assigned quest)

rules.text: Progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: Clambering out of the pit is hard work. Several times, your hands slip, and the abrasive coral scrapes your skin and armour, but inch by inch you near the glinting light at the top of the cavern. Finally, after an hour of hard struggle, you drag yourself over the edge, rolling gratefully onto the forest floor.

rules.text:
Each hunter suffers 2 damage.
Progress to entry 8.

flavor.text: Driven on by sheer grit, you find yourself facing a wall of stone, stratified with quartz, and crystal. The rock is sheer, but breaches nearby; a hole, leading down into darkness. What lies in the shadows?

prompt.text: Do you drop through the hole in the wall?

rules.text: Progress to entry 24.

Discard 1 time card.
Progress to entry 26.

flavor.text: The earth seems to shift, throwing you from your feet and sending you falling, down, down, into darkness! You land heavily, and groan as the air is driven from your lungs.

rules.text:
Each hunter suffers 2 damage. Roll a die.
On a 1-2 you find yourself in a cave with a wide open entrance leading back to the forest.
Progress to entry 27.
On a 3-4 you find yourself in a chamber that looks like someone has mined here in the past.
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 16.
On a 5-6 you find yourself lost in the darkness.
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 10.

flavor.text: The smell hits you before you’ve even taken a step into the clearing around the pond. Spoiling meat and blood. Anjanath was here, you’re certain of it. But it isn’t anymore. The corpse of a small Jagras is, though. Its throat has been torn out, most of its innards are gone. Anjanath fed well, which means it’s moving slower now. The hunt is on!

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Monster Keenbone, and 1 Quality Bone.

rules.text: Progress to entry 17.
Progress to entry 21.

flavor.text: The entrance to the cave is far more slippery than it appeared…slick with rain water and mucus and blood. With a yell of alarm, you scramble to steady yourself as you slip backwards, tumbling off the rocky outcrop and back into the dense morass of the swamp.

consequences.text: Discard 1 time card and place it to one side of the deck.

rules.text: Progress to entry 17.

prompt.text: Clamber back onto the rock, and look around for more remains.

rules.text: Progress to entry 21.

flavor.text: Your choice to press on, against the dust and the sun, was the right one. Ahead, you hear the unmistakeable bellow of the beast you seek. Fear and anticipation courses along your spine. You draw your weapons, and steel yourself. Battle is nearly upon you.

rules.text:
If the number of time cards to the side of the deck is equal to or less than the number of track tokens, discard the cards then progress to entry 31.
If the number of time cards to the side of the deck is higher than the number of track tokens, discard the cards then progress to entry 30.

flavor.text: Where are you? You’re uncertain. You thought you knew this part of the forest, but things are suddenly subtly wrong; the roots trip you, the trees loom over you. You’re lost.

rules.text:
Each hunter recovers 2 health. Discard 1 track token, then if the party has less than three track tokens, shuffle an Aimless Wandering card into the time deck.
Progress to entry 23.

prompt.text: Time to break out of here!

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 9.

flavor.text: There’s still some ore here, you think. But it’ll require considerable work to extricate it. Do you want to spend the time, hacking at solid rock? Or track your prey through the stone corridors?

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards.
Each hunter gains 1 Fucium ore, and 1 Dragonite ore.
Progress to entry 28.
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 20.
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 10.

flavor.text: Anjanath moved this way. Its tracks are closer together; it’s moving slower, satiated from feeding so heavily. It’s far from difficult to follow.

rules.text:
Each hunter rolls on the following table.
1-2 Gain 2 track tokens, then progress to entry 11
3-4 Gain or reveal 1 track token
5-6 Gain 2 track tokens
Once each hunter has rolled, progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: You clamber onto a rocky outcrop, pleased to be out of the mud and ooze of the swamp. It’s bigger than it appeared from below; there’s an opening in the stone, a cave, stretching back several metres into the darkness. The scent of damp fur and urine seeps from the shadows...

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card.
Each hunter suffers 2 damage, and gains 1 Anjanath Pelt.
Progress to entry 26.
Progress to entry 22.

prompt.text: Size it up and follow the trail!

condition.text: (The players may only choose this option if they have at least 11 Anjanath Fang in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Each hunter gains 1 Anjanath Fang.
Progress to entry 13.

flavor.text: You pass out beyond the fringe of trees, confronted by the dizzying expanse of the great plains. Huge, unyielding flatness stretching beyond you, almost blinding after the closeness of the forest. You can’t see Anjanath, but it can’t hide out here. If, of course, it went this way…

prompt.text: Strike out across the great plain.

rules.text: Progress to entry 25.

prompt.text: You need to rest. Shelter in a nearby cavern, that has a discarded pick outside.

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 16.

flavor.text: A violent shudder is your only warning before a crevasse opens beneath you, sending you tumbling into a new chamber with a hard bump. Lighting a torch, you survey your surroundings. Soft, chalky blue coral surrounds you on all sides. There’s something alluring about it, gentle almost. You run your hands over the crumbling rock. It may be beautiful, but you’re trapped. How will you get out?

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Coral Crystal, and 1 Dragonvein Crystal.

prompt.text: Try and climb up, out through a skylight.

rules.text: Discard 3 time cards. Progress to entry 9.

flavor.text: The Jagras isn’t the only corpse. The forest here is littered with kills, leading up to a cave. A lair, maybe. Anjanath hasn’t even bothered to feed; the killing was enough. Something like fear twists in your stomach; this is a creature that kills for sport, not simply for food.

rules.text:
Each hunter rolls on the following table.
1-2 Gain 1 Boulder Bone
3-4 Gain 1 Warm Pelt
5-6 Gain 1 Potion
Once each hunter has rolled, progress to entry 19.

condition.text: (The players may only choose this option if they have at least 1 Anjanath Scale in their inventories)

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Each hunter gains 1 Anjanath Fang.
Progress to entry 10.

flavor.text: You start out immediately, trying to deduce the route the monster followed through the forest. You’ve been at this work a long time now; you know what you’re doing. And soon, you’re onto its trail. A trail marked with the bones of its victims.

consequences.text: Each hunter gains 1 Monster Bone large.

prompt.text: Keep following the remains, and follow them up into the valley.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Flame Sac.
Progress to entry 7.
Progress to entry 19.

flavor.text: Lost. You don’t want to admit it, but you are. The forest presses in on all sides, an indistinguishable mass of green foliage. You force your way through endless boughs and brush, snatching at your face and hands, the squawk of birds a mocking chorus to your lack of progress.

rules.text: Progress to entry 29.

flavor.text: You squeeze through into the cool, dry, darkness of the cave. You lick drops of blood from your fingers—scraping in through the narrow fissure in the stone wall was a tighter fit than you’d expected. You take a deep breath. You almost feel safe…

rules.text: Each hunter suffers 2 damage. Progress to entry 20.

flavor.text: The heat and sparseness of the plains makes crossing it exhausting work. The ground beneath your feet is parched, cracked open by the sun. The relentless pulse of the sun on your back is a burden you can’t shake off. The fatigue settles in your bones. What’s your next move?

consequences.text: If the hunters cannot discard a potion, each hunter suffers 2 damage.

prompt.text: Not the easiest choice, but the right one. You turn back.

rules.text: Discard 3 time cards. Progress to entry 27.

prompt.text: You haven’t come this far to retreat now.

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card and place it to one side of the deck.
Progress to entry 14.

prompt.text: Your instincts tell you you’re close to something big. It might not look it, but you’re close. You just know it.

condition.text: (The hunters may only choose this option if they have completed the Anjanath assigned quest)

rules.text: Discard 1 time card. Each hunter gains 1 Wingdrake Hide, and 1 Firecell Stone. Progress to entry 7.

flavor.text: You’ve found a new path through the forest. Has this been formed by the passage of an Anjanath, its bulk forcing aside foliage, yielding a different route through the trees? or is it the work of a different creature, leading you further away from your goal?

rules.text:
Discard 1 time card. Reveal 1 track token.
Progress to entry 27.

Discard 1 time card. Gain 1 track token.
Progress to entry 15.

flavor.text: The journey across the plains left you utterly exhausted. The ache in your limbs is constant, and lifting your weapons requires an energy you barely possess. You stumble across a small clearing on the forest’s fringes. It’s open; easily defensible… as close to safe as anything gets out here.

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Each hunter recovers 2 health.
Progress to entry 28.

prompt.text: Tiredness is no excuse. No time to lose. You push on.

rules.text: Progress to entry 10.

flavor.text: Building a campfire was a good idea; the warmth seeps into your skin, soothing away some of the pains of the trek. Fire and rest won’t be enough to cure your fatigue by themselves, but it’s a damn fine start.

prompt.text: You can recover a little, but a short rest does only so much.

rules.text:
Discard 1 potion. If the players cannot discard a potion, shuffle the Exhaustion card into the time deck.
Discard 1 time card. Progress to entry 15.

flavor.text: The shrieking of birds suddenly drops away, leaving you in a sudden moment of silence. Then a roar sunders the silence, so loud it leaves your head shaking with its echo. Anjanath is upon you, its jaws snapping inches from your face as it sprints out of the forest’s embrace.

rules.text: Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

flavor.text: The roar was closer than you thought. Much closer. As in, right behind you. You weren’t hunting it. It’s been hunting you, and now, it strikes, giving you no chance to prepare. With a sudden, violent snap of its neck, it tries to knock you from your feet. Battle is joined.

rules.text: Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.

flavor.text: Anjanath stalks the ground, just ahead of you, its vast bulk shaking dust clouds from the dry earth. The creature’s distinctive crest flares from its head, the scent of charred flesh and sulphur hanging heavy over the scene. You grasp your weapons tightly in clammy hands, armour straps biting slightly into your flesh. It’s time to fight!

rules.text:
Discard 2 time cards. Gain 4 track tokens.
Reveal your track tokens, check the Scoutfly level, and begin the hunting phase.
